overview: From 2025-12-14 to 2025-12-21, elizaos-plugins/registry had 2 new PRs (2 merged), 0 new issues, and 5 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: detect version/core dependency mismatches and fix supports flags
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

Improves the registry generation script to:
1. **Detect and warn** about package version vs core dependency mismatches
2. **Correctly set `supports` flags** based on actual core dependency (not package version)

## The Problem

Some plugins have mismatched versioning:
- **v0 packages depending on v1 core** (e.g., `@nuggetslife/plugin-nuggets@0.1.0` → `@elizaos/core: 1.5.5`)
- **v1 packages depending on v0 core** (e.g., `@elizaos/plugin-ankr@1.0.0` → `@elizaos/core: ^0.25.9`)

Previously, these plugins were incorrectly marked in the `supports` field, making them undiscoverable.

## The Solution

### 1. Core dependency determines compatibility

The core dependency is what actually matters for compatibility:

| Scenario | supports.v0 | supports.v1 | Warning |
|----------|-------------|-------------|---------|
| v0 pkg + v0 core | ✓ | - | - |
| v0 pkg + v1 core | - | ✓ | "should publish as v1.x" |
| v1 pkg + v1 core | - | ✓ | - |
| v1 pkg + v0 core | ✓ | - | "needs to update core" |

### 2. Conservative regex for mismatch detection

Only matches **definitive** constraints (`^0.x`, `~0.x`, `0.x`), excludes ambiguous operators (`>=`, `<`) that could span multiple majors.

## Example Output

```
Processing @nuggetslife/plugin-nuggets...
@nuggetslife/plugin-nuggets → v0:false v1:true

⚠️  Issues encountered for 8 repositories:
  @elizaos/plugin-ankr:
    - ⚠️ v1 package (1.0.0) depends on v0 core (^0.25.9) - needs to update @elizaos/core to ^1.0.0
  @nuggetslife/plugin-nuggets:
    - ⚠️ v0 package (0.1.0) depends on v1 core (1.5.5) - should publish as v1.x
```

## Affected Packages

| Package | Issue | Now Marked As |
|---------|-------|---------------|
| `@elizaos/plugin-ankr` | v1 pkg with v0 core | `supports.v0: true` |
| `@elizaos/plugin-near` | v1 pkg with v0 core | `supports.v0: true` |
| `@elizaos/plugin-local-ai` | v0 pkg with v1 core | `supports.v1: true` |
| `@nuggetslife/plugin-nuggets` | v0 pkg with v1 core | `supports.v1: true` |
| `@kudo-dev/plugin-kudo` | v0 pkg with v1 core | `supports.v1: true` |
| `@theschein/plugin-polymarket` | v0 pkg with v1 core | `supports.v1: true` |
| `plugin-octav` | v0 pkg with v1 core | `supports.v1: true` |
| `@esscrypt/plugin-polkadot` | v0 pkg with v1 core | `supports.v1: true` |

## Changes

- Add `getCoreRangeMajor()` helper with conservative regex
- Set `supports.v1 = true` for v0 packages that depend on v1 core
- Set `supports.v0 = true` for v1 packages that depend on v0 core  
- Add warnings to issues summary for versioning problems

topPRs.title: feat: add plugin-farcaster-local-hub
topPRs.author: AntoineVergne
topPRs.body:
Self-hosted Farcaster plugin using local Snapchain/Hubble hub. No Neynar or external API dependencies.

Includes fixes for:
- Farcaster timestamp epoch (Jan 1, 2021)
- Hub API reverse=true for recent data first

Generated with love by a collaboration between a Human and a Synthetic intelligence (Antoine & Claude)

 ## Key Features
  - Direct hub communication via gRPC (writes) and HTTP (reads)
  - No external API costs or dependencies
  - Includes Farcaster timestamp epoch fix (Jan 1, 2021)
  - Hub API reverse=true fix for recent data first
  - Automatic mention detection and channel scanning
  - Rate limiting and daily quotas

  ## Why This Plugin?

Enables fully self-hosted Farcaster agents without relying on Neynar, reducing costs and improving decentralization.

## Registry Update Checklist
If not an eliza-plugins official repo, i.e. new plugin: 

The plugin repo has:
- [x ] is publically accessible (not a private repo)
- [ X] uses main as it's default branch
- [X] I have include `elizaos-plugins` in the topics in the GitHub repo settings. If the plugin is related to `AI` or `crypto`, please add those as topics as well.
- [X ] add simple description in github repo
- [ X] follows this convention
```
plugin-name/
├── images/
│   ├── logo.jpg        # Plugin branding logo
│   ├── banner.jpg      # Plugin banner image
├── src/
│   ├── index.ts        # Main plugin entry point
│   ├── actions/        # Plugin-specific actions
│   ├── clients/        # Client implementations
│   ├── adapters/       # Adapter implementations
│   └── types.ts        # Type definitions
│   └── environment.ts  # runtime.getSetting, zod validation
├── package.json        # Plugin dependencies
└── README.md          # Plugin documentation
```
- [ ] an `images/banner.jpg` and `images/logo.jpg` and they
  - Use clear, high-resolution images
  - Keep file sizes optimized (< 500KB for logos, < 1MB for banners)
  - Follow the [elizaOS Brand Guidelines](https://github.com/elizaOS/brandkit)
  - Include alt text for accessibility
- [ ] package.json has a agentConfig like the following
```json
{
  "name": "@myNpmOrg/plugin-example",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "agentConfig": {
    "pluginType": "elizaos:plugin:1.0.0",
    "pluginParameters": {
      "API_KEY": {
        "type": "string",
        "description": "API key for the service"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

<!-- If you are on Discord, please join https://discord.gg/elizaOS and state your Discord username here for the contributor role and join us in #development-feed -->
<!--
## antoinevergne

-->

  * Expanded plugin registry with Farcaster Local Hub plugin availability.

## Summary

1. **Detect and warn** about package version vs core dependency mismatches

## The Problem

topContributors.summary: madjin: Focused on enhancing content delivery for the `elizaos/elizaos.github.io` project by implementing a new RSS feed feature. They merged two significant PRs to add the feed endpoint (#172) and then fix its URL configuration (#175), with code changes primarily split between feature work and bug fixes. Madjin also planned for future work by creating several issues, including a blocker for a Next.js upgrade (#176) and a feature request for fuzzy search (#174).

borisudovicic: Focused on product definition and planning for the `elizaos/eliza` application, creating 24 issues to scope out a significant user experience overhaul. These issues detail a wide range of improvements, from terminology changes (elizaos/eliza#6240) and component redesigns to a full dashboard overhaul (elizaos/eliza#6222) and new guided onboarding (elizaos/eliza#6221).

standujar: Focused on a significant refactoring effort to unify the messaging API, opening pull requests in the Discord (#32) and Telegram (#22) plugins. This in-progress work was substantial, modifying 328 files with over 12k lines of new code. Their contributions this week were primarily centered on refactoring and feature development.

AntoineVergne: This week's focus was on expanding the plugin ecosystem by adding the new `plugin-farcaster-local-hub` to the registry in PR elizaos-plugins/registry#243. In addition to this feature work, they also provided one review comment. This activity centered on modifying configuration files to enable new functionality.

0xbbjoker: This week, 0xbbjoker focused on extensive bugfix work, committing substantial changes (+3636/-1121 lines) across 57 files. In addition to this work, they supported the team by providing 3 code reviews and proposed a feature improvement for the agent creator in issue elizaos/eliza#6245.
tdnupe3 initiated planning for a new payment feature by creating an issue in elizaos/eliza (#6244) that outlines an implementation guide for integrating Circle and Coinbase APIs.
